title: U.S. Life Insurance Sales Rise on Covid-19 Fears
sub_head: In 2021, U.S. premium volume and number of policies issued saw biggest gains since 1980s
body:
Americans went on a buying spree for life insurance in 2021, driven by concerns of death from the continuing coronavirus pandemic.
Premium volume for new individual life-insurance policies surged 20% compared with 2020, while the number of policies issued rose 5%, the biggest year-over-year percentage gains since the 1980s, according to industry-funded research firm Limra.
